headline: Great Work Environment
pros:
Great office space
Nice People
Free lunch and dinner
cons: Long hours at the end of the month, quarter, and year

headline: Amazing company and culture
pros: Very nice culture. Cares about employees and at the same time, can deliver good investment results.
cons: A bit conservative on AUM growth.

headline: Great Culture
pros: Great culture, smart and driven colleagues.
cons: Workplace technology could be improved

headline: Great Company
pros: Low egos, smart people, no office politics, meal comp
cons: Below market pay, long hours

headline: Top
pros: Love working in the state
cons: No down working in there

headline: Great company
pros:
- lots of ownership
- work with smart people
- great culture
- room for growth
- great benefits
cons:
- lots of pressure
- not the best comp

headline: Nice culture
pros:
Free lunch 
People 
Got pay
cons: Old school style with stagnant aum

headline: Great for high school kids
pros: Discounted meals and Co workers were nice
cons: Constantly on your feet, short staffed and underpaid

headline: Good part time job
pros: Flexible hours. Good if youre in school. They close earlier for a restaurant.
cons: Customer service is hit or miss. Most customers are respectful some are not. Management was okay. Servers forced to tip out on every bill.

headline: Miserable Management
pros: Good food and fun coworkers
cons: Managers at these establishments are clearly overrun and underpaid. They take it out on employees and are not respectful of our personal lives.

headline: laid back, low stress, high pay
pros: Most teams were laid paid and fairly high paid for relatively little stress. (There are one or two teams that are a big exception, though)
cons: Subpar technology. Sometimes felt like management wasn't directing well.

headline: Amazing company
pros: Great learning and place to grow as a professional
cons: Limited growth opportunities, depending on group

headline: Loved it
pros: Very good food. Love customer
cons: Bad management. Can get very hectic

headline: Great culture, lots of perks
pros: The people are incredible, intelligent, hard working, and kind!
cons: Salaries and bonus lower than other firms

headline: Okay
pros: coworkers, schedule flexibility, awesome if you are studying for college
cons: pay system. the chefs are the restaurants main priority

headline: serving job
pros: They're always busy so theres plenty of work
cons: people dont tip well and alot of people try to get discounts

headline: Server
pros: Short hours with included tups.
cons: Management was not ran properly.

headline: Culture
pros: Amazing culture - network of professional and educated individuals who are looking to succeed and create an inclusive work environment
cons: Nothing material to share for cons

headline: very good culture
pros: people here are decent and cordial
cons: there are some office politics

headline: Analyst
pros: good vacation/benefits, good salary and bonus potential
cons: long hours for junior staff members

headline: Investor Relations
pros: Great work culture and smart/driven team
cons: No cons to mention currently

headline: Great company
pros: Have really enjoyed being a part of the firm. Good culture, smart people, competitive pay.
cons: More interaction between groups would be helpful.

headline: Not Diverse enough
pros: None to speak of right now
cons: Company culture not diverse and inclusiveve

headline: Good depending on team
pros: Good pay, great benefits, most teams were generally friendly and laid-back (though there are a few exceptions).
cons:
Formal dress code (including ties) when I was there (although I've heard that's relaxed now). 
Software infrastructure was average , at best.

headline: It's a good place to work.
pros: Many of professionals have worked together.
cons: You always have a lot of work.

headline: Great Company, Great Culture
pros: Most managers seem to really care about their employees.
cons: Some parts of firm are stuffy and rigid. Depends a lot on who your manager is.

headline: Stuffy Culture with lack.if clear direction
pros: Great perks and benefits with free lunch
cons: Workforce needs to diverse and you get ahead if your apart of an office clique

headline: Joining AG was the best decision I have ever made!
pros: Culture is unlike any hedge fund, PE shop, or bank. Family feel, zero egos, open door policy, and everyone is happy to teach/learn from one another.
cons: Would be great to have more formalized mentor program.

headline: Intern
pros: Great perks, incredibly friendly people
cons: There are no cons of working here

headline: Great Company
pros: AG has a great culture, highly recommend the firm.
cons: None that I can think of.

headline: Vice President
pros: Great culture, the environment is very collaborative and individual ideas are recognized. One of the best hedge funds to work for.
cons: Leadership varies by department, some areas are run with an iron fist while others have more freedom. There is not much upward mobility as turnover is limited, so be prepared to be stuck in your role a while.

headline: Current employee
pros: Similar pay and bonus compared to competitors.
cons: Culture and worklife flexibility need improvement. Lots of people who have been there for years who are very set in their ways. Also not a lot of room for growth and development.

headline: Solid firm
pros: Great benefits and you will learn a lot
cons: Be prepared to deal with some rude people

headline: Associate
pros: Culture and pizza fridays lunch
cons: Deal teams are very segregated

headline: Great company!
pros: Friendly team, highly motivated people, the company pays for lunch every day, beautiful offices.
cons: None that I can think of

headline: Love it
pros: This company is wonderful and I'm beyond lucky to have been able to work for them for the past 2 years!
cons: More bilateral movement for employees

headline: Smart Folks
pros: A fairly lean organization stocked with smart professionals.  Generally collegial.
cons: Not many.  Most flaws have been addressed by most recent shake-up.

headline: A great learning opportunity
pros: The time spent on a number of diverse and interesting projects
cons: Nothing major. It is a good company.

headline: Know the right people
pros: If you know the right people, you can go very, very far, with very little effort. With only a handful of people in the IT department, I entered into a newly created senior position right below the new CIO.
cons: None. It's finance. As long as you do exactly what your manager asks without question, you'll get a huge bonus and base salary.

headline: Park Avenue Money
pros: My time at Angelo, Gordon was spent on a number of diverse and interesting projects. Compensation was competitive and appropriate for my time and effort, and benefits are comprehensive.
cons: The firm is in long term operational transition across all departments and a cultural change that generally doesn't look good for anyone except senior management and high performing portfolio managers.
